column4: I installed 1.10 and the screen resolution if 800X600 and it kind of looks fuzzy. I thought I would go in and change the resolution, but it only gives me 800by600 and 640by480. How do I get other resolutions to choose from?

I installed 1.10 and the screen resolution if 800X600 and it kind of looks fuzzy. I thought I would go in and change the resolution, but it only gives me 800by600 and 640by480. How do I get other resolutions to choose from?
ah.. then it makes more sense =) you have to setup xorg for your videocard.. what are you using? nvidia? ati?
I'm not sure, how I would I find out?
its a old gateway solo laptop
I'm kind of new to ubuntu myself.. but try typing lspci at a terminal and search for something that looks like a graphics adapter
yes.. that looks like it might be the one
now you have to find a driver for this card.. since it's not nvidia or ati it might be a little tricky.. try googling for "neomagic magicgraph ubuntu" or something like that
, I did find a driver on ubuntulinux.org. I see if that works
nice.. there should be some kind of readme on how to get it working too
